qas.question: Paragraph 6 of Article 29 states that a referendum, in the event of a successful petition should be held within how many years?
What did the Hesse state government due when the May 5, 1958 deadline passed?
When was the Hesse state government's complaint dismissed?
On what grounds was the Hesse state government's complaint dismissed
Which article claimed if a petition was successful there was no need for a referendum?
Which government filed a request to change their constitution?
By who was the Hesse state government's complaint heard?

plausible_answers.text: Article 29 had made the new delimitation of the federal territory

qas.question: Why did the constitutional court decide to hear the Hesse State complaint?
Who did the court tell they had a requirement to bind territorial revisions?

context: Paragraph 6 of <b4_0>Article 29<b4_0/> stated that if a petition was successful a referendum should be held within <a0_0>three<a0_0/> years. Since the deadline passed on 5 May 1958 without anything happening the <b5_0><b8_0>Hesse state<b8_0/><b5_0/> government <a1_0>filed a constitutional complaint<a1_0/> with the <b6_0>Federal Constitutional Court<b6_0/> in October 1958. The complaint was dismissed in <a2_0>July 1961<a2_0/> on the grounds that <b7_0>Article 29 had made the new delimitation of the federal territory<b7_0/> an <a3_0>exclusively federal matter<a3_0/>. At the same time, the Court reaffirmed the requirement for a territorial revision as a binding order to the relevant constitutional bodies.
